column4: Gigs how you installed audacious? from apt-get or compiling it yourself?
apt-get
standard repos
8.04 LTS
did you run it before?
I suspect if you already had an audacious playlist you wouldn't get this error :P
one way to test would be for you to move ~/.config/audacious to a new name and then try to start audacious on your system
if it fails to regenerate a default config we know it's a global bug
ok thanks
heh hmm, well it no longer gives the error at least!
but when I run audacious it returns to the command line with no error
$? is 0 also so no error code
so now it just does nothing hehe
wait there was a hung one in the background
now that I killed it it works
well I haven't tested it.  But I think I know what was happening
I assumed the failed to load error was fatal, and that is why it was exiting
but instead it was exiting because a copy was already running
there is no message if it exits due to an already running copy
I think it is working now
the hung background process was making it exit, and the non-fatal message about a missing playlist mislead me
